title: Electrical Cable Design Optimization: PBL-Based Practical Project

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental electrical engineering concepts (voltage, current, resistance) and ability to perform simple engineering calculations
context.additional_context: Learners access online materials and collaborative platforms via smartphones, while performing hands-on activities during offline sessions

learning_goals: Learners can explain the electrical cable design process that satisfies given engineering requirements (efficient use of insulation, maximum load current, minimum outer diameter).
Learners can derive cable specifications by applying core engineering principles such as insulation adjustment, current-carrying capacity, and power loss calculations.
Learners can propose design solutions that simultaneously minimize material costs and reduce power loss using material selection and optimization techniques.

resources: PDF Calculation Guide and Case Study Resource Pack
Low-Cost Measurement Equipment Kit for Offline Practical Use
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
